text: The full text of President Obama's second inaugural address:http://OFA.BO/Hq4o8f
author: BarackObama

text: Thank you, God Bless you, and may He forever bless these United States of America.
author: BarackObama

text: Let us answer the call of history, and carry into an uncertain future that precious light of freedom. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: You and I, as citizens, have the obligation to shape the debates of our time.
author: BarackObama

text: You and I, as citizens, have the power to set this country’s course.
author: BarackObama

text: We must act, knowing that our work will be imperfect. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: We cannot mistake absolutism for principle, or substitute spectacle for politics, or treat name-calling as reasoned debate.
author: BarackObama

text: Our journey is not complete until all our children know that they are cared for, and cherished, and always safe from harm.
author: BarackObama

text: Our journey is not complete until we find a better way to welcome the immigrants who still see America as a land of opportunity.
author: BarackObama

text: Our journey is not complete until no citizen is forced to wait for hours to exercise the right to vote.
author: BarackObama

text: Our journey is not complete until our gay brothers and sisters are treated like anyone else under the law.
author: BarackObama

text: Our journey is not complete until our wives, our mothers, and daughters can earn a living equal to their efforts.
author: BarackObama

text: We, the people, declare today that the most evident of truths—that all of us are created equal—is the star that guides us still.
author: BarackObama

text: We, the people, still believe that enduring security and lasting peace do not require perpetual war.
author: BarackObama

text: We will respond to the threat of climate change, knowing that the failure to do so would betray our children and future generations.
author: BarackObama

text: We do not believe that in this country, freedom is reserved for the lucky, or happiness for the few.
author: BarackObama

text: We, the people, still believe that every citizen deserves a basic measure of security and dignity. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: We, the people, understand that our country cannot succeed when a shrinking few do very well and a growing many barely make it.
author: BarackObama

text: We are made for this moment, and we will seize it—so long as we seize it together. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: A decade of war is now ending. An economic recovery has begun. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: Now, more than ever, we must do these things together, as one nation and one people. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: We have always understood that when times change, so must we. —President Obama
author: BarackObama

text: Stand with President Obama for an America built to last:http://OFA.BO/3Bfuox
author: BarackObama

text: Our journey moves forward, our future is hopeful, and the state of our Union will always be strong." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: As long as we’re joined in common purpose, as long as we maintain our common resolve...
author: BarackObama

text: This nation is great because we worked as a team. This nation is great because we get each other’s backs.
author: BarackObama

text: No one built this country on their own. This nation is great because we built it together.
author: BarackObama

text: President Obama: "Those of us who’ve been sent here to serve can learn from the service of our troops.
author: BarackObama

text: Tonight, I’m proposing a Veterans Job Corps that will help our communities hire veterans as cops and firefighters.
author: BarackObama

text: As they come home, we must serve them as well as they've served us." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Above all, our freedom endures because of the men and women in uniform who defend it.
author: BarackObama

text: Anyone who tells you that America is in decline or that our influence has waned doesn’t know what they’re talking about." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: We will support policies that lead to strong and stable democracies and open markets, because tyranny is no match for liberty.
author: BarackObama

text: With or without this Congress, I will keep taking actions that help the economy grow. But I can do a whole lot more with your help.
author: BarackObama

text: Send me a bill that bans insider trading by members of Congress, and I will sign it tomorrow." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Some of this has to do with the corrosive influence of money in politics.
author: BarackObama

text: On the other hand, if you make under $250,000 a year, like 98% of American families, your taxes shouldn’t go up.
author: BarackObama

text: Tax reform should follow the Buffett rule: If you make more than $1 million a year, you should not pay less than 30% in taxes.
author: BarackObama

text: Do we want to keep these tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans? Or do we want to keep our investments in everything else?
author: BarackObama

text: Right now, Warren Buffett pays a lower tax rate than his secretary.
author: BarackObama

text: So let’s agree right here, right now: No side issues. No drama. Pass the payroll tax cut without delay.
author: BarackObama

text: And I will not go back to the days when Wall Street was allowed to play by its own set of rules." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: I will not go back to the days when health insurance companies had unchecked power to cancel your policy.
author: BarackObama

text: It’s time to apply the same rules from top to bottom: No bailouts, no handouts, and no copouts.
author: BarackObama

text: Millions of Americans who work hard and play by the rules every day deserve a government and a financial system that do the same.
author: BarackObama

text: I’m sending this Congress a plan that gives every responsible homeowner the chance to save about $3,000 a year on their mortgage.
author: BarackObama

text: President Obama: "I will not walk away from the promise of clean energy." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: That means women should earn equal pay for equal work." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: An economy built to last is one where we encourage the talent and ingenuity of every person in this country.
author: BarackObama

text: We should be working on comprehensive immigration reform right now." #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Join me in a national commitment to train two million Americans with skills that will lead directly to a job.
author: BarackObama

text: I’m announcing the creation of a Trade Enforcement Unit charged with investigating unfair trading practices in countries like China.
author: BarackObama

text: It is time to stop rewarding businesses that ship jobs overseas, and start rewarding companies that create jobs right here in America.
author: BarackObama

text: The state of our Union is getting stronger. And we’ve come too far to turn back now.
author: BarackObama

text: In the last 22 months, businesses have created more than three million jobs.
author: BarackObama

text: Or we can restore an economy where everyone gets a fair shot, everyone does their fair share, & everyone plays by the same set of rules.
author: BarackObama

text: We can either settle for a country where a shrinking number of people do really well, while a growing number of Americans barely get by.
author: BarackObama

text: It is because of our people that our future is hopeful, our journey goes forward, and the state of our union is strong. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: From the earliest days of our founding, America has been the story of ordinary people who dare to dream. That’s how we win the future. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Starting this year, no American will be forbidden from serving the country they love because of who they love. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: This July, we will begin to bring our troops home from Afghanistan. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: We shouldn’t just give our people a government that’s more affordable. We should give them a gov't that’s more competent & efficient. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Every day, families sacrifice to live within their means. They deserve a government that does the same. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Instead of re-fighting the battles of the last two years, let’s fix what needs fixing and move forward. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: I’m not willing to go back to the days when insurance companies could deny someone coverage because of a pre-existing condition. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: I’m asking Democrats and Republicans to simplify the tax code. Get rid of the loopholes. Level the playing field. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: We need the fastest, most reliable ways to move people, goods, and information—from high-speed rail to high-speed Internet. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: I strongly believe that we should take on, once and for all, the issue of illegal immigration. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: If you want to make a difference in the life of our nation; if you want to make a difference in the life of a child—become a teacher. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: If we want to win the future—if we want innovation to produce jobs in America—then we also have to win the race to educate our kids. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Tonight I challenge you to join me in setting a new goal: by 2035, 80% of America’s electricity will come from clean energy sources. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Instead of subsidizing yesterday’s energy, let’s invest in tomorrow’s. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: This is our generation’s Sputnik moment. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: What we can do—what America does better than anyone—is spark the creativity and imagination of our people. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: We need to out-innovate, out-educate, and out-build the rest of the world. We have to make America the best place to do business. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: The future is ours to win. But to get there, we can’t just stand still. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: The world has changed. The competition for jobs is real. But this shouldn’t discourage us. It should challenge us. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Thanks to the tax cuts we passed, Americans’ paychecks are a little bigger today. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: We measure progress by the success of our people. By the jobs they can find and the quality of life those jobs offer. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: Two years after the worst recession most of us have ever known...the economy is growing again. #SOTU
author: BarackObama

text: We will move forward together, or not at all—for the challenges we face are bigger than party and bigger than politics. #SOTU
